body: We need you to address the issue first, then we could discuss how to solve the issue.
when i removed agent, my projects were runing  well

This is unhelpful. I know this is caused by agent, but how and which part? Agent is complex, this could only be solved if you try to find out why.
Such as,
1. Try to remove all plugins, but still attaches the agent
2. Choose the plugin one by one, and add it back to plugin folder, and reboot.

Basically, I need you to explain the plugin design. I am a little confused about what you are trying to do here.
1. When RPC happens, which plugins work for tracing? Such as, Tomcat? HttpClient? Or something else?
1. If the local span of handler is the only thing created, then what is the key point to add this plugin? Is this plugin just playing the simplest role, which is adding a span in an existing trace, but not related to any metrics of service or topology map.
You need to translate the reply to English.
Read the document carefully. Whoch time zone of your k8s. I assume utc 0. Choose utc from UI or change oap timezone.

But how to handle a case when within application A we may have a couple of steps and each step (component) generate its own span and finally one of them will generate a http request to application B?

component A (app A) -> component B (app A) -> component C (app A) -> http GET -> component A (app B)

Is it possible possible to generate the correct relations and present a tree on Tracing tab (Gui)?

You could add plugin source codes(or skywalking source codes) to your debug project(being monitored one). Or use remote debug(IDEA provided)

I assume you know Chinese, read http://skywalking.apache.org/zh/blog/2019-01-24-skywalking-remote-debug.html

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23427495/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23427495)

Coverage increased (+0.005%) to 16.549% when pulling **af93e2371b81f8044d23d0e38d76d3ef864361da on wayilau:fix_bug1** into **b76839fe4ca7d02b3c09c7a66968c3d1e4323d71 on apache:master**.

In the current analysis codes, I will say it is hard. Transfer zipkin span to SkyWalking segment has too many limits. That is why I submit the `no-analysis` mode. 

In my mind, I prefer to build new analysis codes based on `no-analysis` mode, meaning, still saving span directly, and build the trace only in query stage. Becaust at that moment, no need to worry about client/server side spans, just build trace segment and segment ref. And only require client/server matching to do analysis, in your case, only try to identify these two spans(`component C (app A) -> http GET -> component A (app B)`), then metrics are generated by these two.

By the way, in SkyWalking native format and agent, we don't need to process this, we will merge component A->C(if they are all RPC client library instrumentations) automatically. We call it StackBasedSpan.

If you want to quick deep dive talk, Join #skywalking channel at [Apache Slack](https://join.slack.com/t/the-asf/shared_invite/enQtNDQ3OTEwNzE1MDg5LWY2NjkwMTEzMGI2ZTI1NzUzMDk0MzJmMWM1NWVmODg0MzBjNjAxYzUwMjIwNDI3MjlhZWRjNmNhOTM5NmIxNDk)

@hanahmily If your tests passed, please merge this. We could provide a blog to teach people how could open ALS, before your PR landed upstream

And have you read the envoy mutation API PR? That is an interesting one.
Please search issue before you submit a new one. This means, you deleted the ElasticSearch, but haven't restarted the agents.
I have restarted the agent, and the error still exists. I don't need your reply any more.

> We could provide a blog to teach people how could open ALS

We CAN NOT teach people to open ALS before istio merge my pr unless we teach the user to change istio source codes. @wu-sheng

> We CAN NOT teach people to open ALS before istio merge my pr unless we teach the user to change istio source codes.

@hanahmily 
Yes, that is my meaning, teach people how to change source codes, but in simple way. **Publish an open repo to show your changes, within one commit and link the compare with the certain isito version/tag.**
Then post a blog on SkyWalking website. 
This makes the document complete and could help us to do public marketing.

Make sense?

btw, this way can debug the apps ,but also i want to debug agent self. when remote debug started, agent has already passed.

You could take a reference from here, https://github.com/SkyAPM/SkyWalking-With-Es5x-Storage 

This repository is not updated for a while. But you can get the idea about how to support ElasticSearch 5.

> Basically, I need you to explain the plugin design. I am a little confused about what you are trying to do here.
> 
> 1. When RPC happens, which plugins work for tracing? Such as, Tomcat? HttpClient? Or something else?
> 2. If the local span of handler is the only thing created, then what is the key point to add this plugin? Is this plugin just playing the simplest role, which is adding a span in an existing trace, but not related to any metrics of service or topology map.



> Basically, I need you to explain the plugin design. I am a little confused about what you are trying to do here.
> 
> 1. When RPC happens, which plugins work for tracing? Such as, Tomcat? HttpClient? Or something else?
> 2. If the local span of handler is the only thing created, then what is the key point to add this plugin? Is this plugin just playing the simplest role, which is adding a span in an existing trace, but not related to any metrics of service or topology map.

1、When RPC happens, the jetty plugin work for tracing.
2、when the xxl-job client is called , because of the client execute job with thread pool and intercept IJobHandler to know the tracing from xxl-job like elastic-job

> btw, this way can debug the apps ,but also i want to debug agent self. when remote debug started, agent has already passed.

No, it wouldn't. Open the `suspend=Y` to your application argument. The application VM will wait for you to attach the agent, then continue to do everything. :)

> 1、When RPC happens, the jetty plugin work for tracing.

If so, then no entry span required.

> 2、when the xxl-job client is called , because of the client execute job with thread pool and intercept IJobHandler to know the tracing from xxl-job like elastic-job

If there is a thread pool in there, you just added a local span, the trace will still break. The right thing is you make the trace continues by using `Context#capture`, `Context#continued` APIs.  Then you know the trace starts with a xxl-job server, and including all spans of your codes.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43592564/57901023-c578cf80-7895-11e9-9778-f35783d8b765.png)
Ask for help. Thank you.
For no trace, I don't know. But for the NPE(s), they mean you delete the storage data, but haven't rebooted the agents.

Right now, you can't. You could choose service, then select the instance belonging to it.
Will you consider implementing this feature in the future? like The First column is cluster name  and the second column is service name blow the cluster @wu-sheng

You are asking about two things.

> Will you consider implementing this feature in the future?

Doing this will break the protocol. I assume no one will do that in the short term. Adjusting protocols need to coordinate all agents to upgrade or set up backend compatible.

> like The First column is cluster name and the second column is service name blow the cluster

What is the context of this? We haven't done anything about the cluster, we provide service and service instance, which two should not be replaced.
@pmq5205209 I am trying to follow Rafael's suggestion to provide a class file locator. Could you show me, how could I set the location? Such as, where are your jdk jars? Or other lib jars?

> 
> 
> @pmq5205209 I am trying to follow Rafael's suggestion to provide a class file locator. Could you show me, how could I set the location? Such as, where are your jdk jars? Or other lib jars?

We use WebSphere's default jdk whose location is "C:\Program Files (x86)\IBM\WebSphere\AppServer3\java". When I replace the jdk version, I just replace this file.
Are all jars of JRE in that folder?

![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19252220/57910951-10580e80-78b9-11e9-83b2-1b6e93aa4d70.png)
Yes, and this is the file's snapshot.
You need to find jars including those classes in your error log. I think there includes JRE jars and WebSphere jars.
你好，这个问题解决了吗，我也遇见了

I cannot find any jars including those classes in the error log. But I find classes in src.zip of WebShpere's default java path. Such as "java.security.BasicPermission".

用中文描述一下问题吧，我在使用skywalking收集多个项目数据时，过一段时间会出现异常。
此时es机器cpu负载会下降。而只使用skywalking收集一个项目数据时则不会有此问题。
出现问题时我重启skywalking服务，数据会恢复正常，期间未对elasticsearch进行过任何操作。
I think English is only preferred here. ASF project needs to be global. In my guess, your ElasticSearch doesn't work well when data grows bigger.

According to different time conditions, the node icons are also different.
Click on the node and the details are of different types: 1. Tomcat; 2. Spring MVC
Component images will be changed by following #2654

I don't know. There is no SkyWalking supporting this or not. This depends on the community. If you want to build a python project, I am happy to help.

The .net, php, nodejs. go agents are all from community.
New protocols are here. https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/protocols/README.md

Beginning to remove expired metrics from the storage.

it is my ElasticSearch has error?
Delete burns more cpu and memory. We are trying to solve this in 6.2
Could you give #2708 a try?
Also, I noticed, why ssl is activated? Also I noticed `Selected collector grpc service running, reconnect:false.`, this should mean the gRPC connected.

Because we don't provide a mechanism to intercept JDK classes. We prefer to intercept the 3rd party library.
I tried it , but the error logs are the same as the old.

HI,
can you share link for 3rd party library.
For the libraries, we supported, check here, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md
please share plugin name which can help us.there are lot of plugin
That is plugin list we supported. `java.net.HttpURLConnection.HttpURLConnection` is not on the list. If you are using that directly, the short answer is we can't trace it today.

Hi,

So basically you are suggesting, to switch off analyzing  (**needAnalysis=true**) and of course to set up storage to  **zipkin-elasticsearch** and to rely on results of `org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.storage.plugin.zipkin.elasticsearch.ZipkinTraceQueryEsDAO`?

This will work but in the same we are losing other extra features like Topology. Am I right?

> This will work but in the same we are losing other extra features like Topology. Am I right?

Yes. That is the part we should build, to replace the current one. Are you interested in deep dive in this about how to generate topology and metrics based on Zipkin spans? I have basic ideas, but there are coding and testing stuff need to be done.

Thanks for the prompt response and clarification, actually I am building this solution for a major customer and this is one of the key requirement, Can you please help me with some documentation to make adjustment in byte-buddy Agentbuilder? This would be of a great help

> Thanks for the prompt response and clarification, actually I am building this solution for a major customer and this is one of the key requirement, Can you please help me with some documentation to make adjustment in byte-buddy Agentbuilder? This would be of a great help

I think I don't have this today. You need to read the byte-buddy document. We are welcome the contributions after you made it.

> As the test tool can't support your PR. Could you provide a screenshot to show the result?

OK

case1:common route
```yml
server:
  port: 8080
spring:
  cloud:
    gateway:
      routes:
      - id: provider_route
        uri: http://${projectB.host}
        predicates:
        - Path=/provider/b/*
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/57971750-96ad4700-79c4-11e9-8160-7f55d2bc3b5b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/57971745-81d0b380-79c4-11e9-95a7-6e8270c870ee.png)

case2:eureka registration center
```yml
server:
  port: 8085
spring:
  cloud:
    gateway:
      discovery:
        locator:
          enabled: true
          lower-case-service-id: true
  application:
    name: spring-cloud-gateway
eureka:
  client:
    service-url: 
      defaultZone: http://localhost:8081/eureka/
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10150229/57972050-391af980-79c8-11e9-807f-b03fde62faec.png)

No feedback if you keep using Chinese. Sorry. This is Apache requirement.
Ok,I want to know why grpc connection can't be established? Can you explain why I failed?Thanks!
Can't see from the log your post. Usually, it is because, oap server binds wrong ip and OSfirewall.

> Can't see from the log your post. Usually, it is because, oap server binds wrong ip and OSfirewall.

ok
Is the topology right? Why Handler span is not the parent of exit span?

This trace looks unclear to me. 

For a gateway, the ideal spans at least are
1. Entry span of gateway.
2. Exit Span to callong upstream system
3. Entry span is the parent of exit span.

Can you explain a little more? And show me the topology?
Also, I noticed the handler is a local span, this local span is created by gateway plugin, right? If you put route info in it, then, make sure, exit span is a children of it.
#2654 is planned to be merged after UI updated. I prefer you could adopt that after merged.
okay
I'll take the works related to TransactionManager (TM) and parts of TransactionCoordinator (TC)
